exception mediator.common.factory.base.HandlerFactoryError[source]#

Bases: Exception

Handler factory error base class.

All sub error classes related to handler factory inherits form it.

exception mediator.common.factory.base.IncompatibleHandlerFactoryError[source]#

Bases: TypeError, HandlerFactoryError

Incompatible handler factory error.

Error is raised when given handler factory input cannot be processed due to its incompatibility to the factory specification.

mediator.common.factory.cascade module#

exception mediator.common.factory.cascade.ConfigHandlerFactoryCascadeError[source]#

Bases: ValueError, HandlerFactoryCascadeError

Handler factory cascade configuration error.

Raised when handler factory cascade is not properly configured.

class mediator.common.factory.cascade.HandlerFactoryCascade[source]#

Bases: object

Handler factory cascade.

This cascade is responsible for trying to map given object into handler using handler factory sequence.

__init__(policies, mapper=None)[source]#

Initializes handler factory cascade. :param policies: iterable providing sequence of policies to map into handler factories :param mapper: (optional)handler factory mapper that maps policies into corresponding handler factories; when not provided DefaultHandlerFactoryMapper is used :raises ConfigHandlerFactoryCascadeError: when no polices are provided

Parameters

  • policies (Iterable[Union[CallableHandlerPolicy, MethodHandlerPolicy, MappablePolicy]]) –

  • mapper (Optional[HandlerFactoryMapper]) –

replace(policies)[source]#

Creates new handler factory cascade that has replaced policy sequence, but uses the same policy to handler factory mapper. :param policies: iterable providing new sequence of policies (specifications) :return: new handler policy cascade initialized using new set of policies and same handler factory mapper

Parameters

policies (Iterable[Union[CallableHandlerPolicy, MethodHandlerPolicy, MappablePolicy]]) –

Return type

HandlerFactoryCascade

exception mediator.common.factory.cascade.HandlerFactoryCascadeError[source]#

Bases: Exception

Handler factory cascade base error.

exception mediator.common.factory.cascade.IncompatibleHandlerFactoryCascadeError[source]#

Bases: HandlerFactoryCascadeError

Incompatible handler factory cascade error.

Raised when handler factory cascade cannot convert given object into handler, which means given object is incompatible and cannot be mapped.

__init__(*args, factory_errors)[source]#

Initializes incompatible handler factory cascade error. :param args: python exception args :param factory_errors: sequence of (<handler factory object>, <given handler factory error>) pairs

Parameters

factory_errors (Sequence[Tuple[HandlerFactory, IncompatibleHandlerFactoryError]]) –

exception mediator.common.factory.cascade.InspectionHandlerFactoryCascadeError[source]#

Bases: HandlerFactoryCascadeError

Handler factory cascade inspection error.

Raised when one of handler factory in cascade raises inspection machinery failure (non usual situation) error.

__init__(*args, factory)[source]#

Initializes inspection handler factory cascade error. :param args: python exception args :param factory: handler factory that raised inspection error

Parameters

factory (HandlerFactory) –

Bases: HandlerFactory

Callable handler factory.

Factory that produces callable handler directly from callable object.

Initializes callable handler factory. :param policy: policy used as a configuration or specification for producing handler object

Parameters

policy (CallableHandlerPolicy) –

create(obj)[source]#

Creates handler directly form callable object. :param obj: callable object :raises IncompatibleHandlerFactoryError: when callable object is incompatible with factory specification :raises HandlerFactoryError: when there is failure during object inspection :return: handler invoking given callable object

Parameters

class mediator.common.factory.mappers.DefaultHandlerFactoryMapper[source]#

Bases: TypeHandlerFactoryMapper

Library default handler factory mapper.

Maps CallableHandlerPolicy objects and MethodHandlerPolicy objects into handler factories.

__init__(extra_mapping=None)[source]#

Initializes library default handler factory mapper. :param extra_mapping: extra policy mapping (policy type -> handler factory provider); may be used to extend or override default handler factory mapping

Parameters

extra_mapping (Optional[Mapping[Type[Any], Callable[[Any], HandlerFactory]]]) –

classmethod default_mapping()[source]#

class mediator.common.factory.mappers.TypeHandlerFactoryMapper[source]#

Bases: HandlerFactoryMapper

Initializes type handler factory mapper. :param mapping: policy type to handler factory provider mapping

Parameters

map(policy)[source]#

Provides handler factory object according to given policy (specification).

policy (Any) – policy to map into handler factory

class mediator.common.factory.policies.CallableHandlerPolicy[source]#

Bases: MappablePolicy

Callable handler policy.

Specification or recipe how to inspect callable object and how should be built handler that invokes it.

__init__(subject_arg=None, arg_map=<factory>, arg_strict=False)#
Parameters

  • subject_arg (Optional[str]) –

  • arg_map (Dict[str, str]) –

  • arg_strict (bool) –

Return type

None

arg_map: Dict[str, str]#
arg_strict: bool = False#
replace_map(policy)[source]#

Maps this policy into new one, patching internals by given policy. :param policy: policy to patch internals :return: new policy that is current one with replaced values form given one

Parameters

policy (MappablePolicy) –

Return type

CallableHandlerPolicy

subject_arg: Optional[str] = None#
property subject_as_keyword#

Should primary argument provided as a keyword arg. :return: True when according to policy primary argument will be always provided as keyword arg, False otherwise

mediator.common.factory.utils module#

class mediator.common.factory.utils.CallableAttributeDetails[source]#

Bases: object

Utility that (optionally) checks if object has valid type and performs callable inspection for given object attribute.

__init__(name, owner_subtype_of=())[source]#

Initializes callable attribute inspection object, that (optionally) checks if object has valid type and performs callable inspection for given object attribute :param name: inspection object attribute name :param owner_subtype_of: sequence of types to check if an instance of an input object is one of them; just like isinstance(obj, owner_subtype_of)

Parameters

  • name (str) –

  • owner_subtype_of (Sequence[Any]) –

name: str#
subtype_of: Tuple[Any, ...]#
class mediator.common.factory.utils.CallableHandlerCreate[source]#

Bases: object

Creates callable handler using given specification.

__init__(subject_as_keyword, arg_map, arg_strict)[source]#

Initializes callable handler factory using given specification. :param subject_as_keyword: force to provide primary (subject) argument as keyword argument :param arg_map: action extra arguments to callable arguments name mapping; used for translation to reconcile argument name differences :param arg_strict: when True all action arguments will be provided for handler, when False only those that fits into handler callable arguments set (excessive ones will be dropped)

Parameters

  • subject_as_keyword (bool) –

  • arg_map (Dict[str, str]) –

  • arg_strict (bool) –

class mediator.common.factory.utils.CallableObjDetails[source]#

Bases: object

Utility that wraps callable object inspection procedure into handler factory world.

class mediator.common.factory.utils.HandlerSubjectArgGet[source]#

Bases: object

Utility that finds primary argument for given callable object, to be filled with action subject (event, request, command etc object).

__init__(name=None)[source]#

Initializes utility that finds primary argument for given callable object. :param name: optional argument name hint; when provided utility will assume argument with that name as primary

Parameters

name (Optional[str]) –

Handler factory cascade.

This cascade is responsible for trying to map given object into handler using handler factory sequence.

Parameters

  • policies (Iterable[Union[CallableHandlerPolicy, MethodHandlerPolicy, MappablePolicy]]) –

  • mapper (Optional[HandlerFactoryMapper]) –

replace(policies)[source]#
